description: Unique system-generated identifier for this project attribute record; used as the primary key and for joins.
User-specified short label for the attribute used in UI and reports; may include a sequence prefix for grouping or ordering.
Free-text explanation or name of the attribute for business users; likely a human-readable description rather than technical metadata. Confirm intended usage with SME.
Internal code indicating the attribute’s data type (such as string, numeric, or date) to drive validation and storage. Confirm code set with SME.
Maximum allowed length or precision for the attribute’s value, used for validation and field sizing.
Indicator showing whether this attribute must be provided when capturing project data (No=optional, Yes=mandatory).
Flag identifying whether the attribute comes from a predefined template/specification versus being ad‑hoc. Likely boolean; confirm with SME.
Unit used to interpret the attribute’s numeric value (e.g., efficiency, distance, counts), enabling consistent aggregation and display.
Value automatically populated for the attribute when none is provided by the user or integration.
Numeric position controlling where this attribute appears in screens or reports; lower numbers display earlier.
System-maintained timestamp of the most recent update to this attribute record.
Optional notes or remarks associated with the attribute for administrative or business context.
Audit timestamp capturing when a user last modified this record. May duplicate the system timestamp; confirm process with SME.
Identifier of the user who originally created this attribute record, for audit purposes.
Timestamp when the record was initially created by a user.
Identifier of the user who last updated this record, for audit tracking.
Timestamp of the most recent user-driven modification to this record.
